thread.title: Michael van Gerwen to miss Premier League match in Exeter with back injury
thread.title_full: Michael van Gerwen to miss Premier League match in Exeter with back injury

title: Michael van Gerwen to miss Premier League match in Exeter with back injury
text:
Michael van Gerwen to miss Premier League match in Exeter with back injury 1 Mar   Michael van Gerwen is hoping to defend his UK Open title in Minehead on Friday Michael van Gerwen will miss round five of the Premier League in Exeter on Thursday because of a back injury. 
The 27-year-old was due to face James Wade but has pulled out to give himself the best chance of recovering in time to play in the UK Open on 3-5 March. 
Van Gerwen, the PDC world champion and world number one, is hoping to win a third successive UK title in Minehead. 
Dave Chisnall will now play twice in Exeter, while Van Gerwen will play two fixtures in Manchester on 23 March. Premier League - revised round five fixtures 
Dave Chisnall (Eng) v Raymond van Barneveld (Ned) 
Jelle Klaasen (Ned) v Kim Huybrechts (Bel) 
Gary Anderson (Sco) v Phil Taylor (Eng) 
Adrian Lewis (Eng) v Peter Wright (Sco) 
James Wade (Eng) v Dave Chisnall (Eng) Share this page
